summary: This bill, the Seniors’ Access to Critical Medications Act of 2025, amends the Social Security Act to create an exception to the physician self-referral prohibition for certain outpatient prescription drugs. It allows physicians and group practices to dispense covered Part D drugs under specific conditions, including an established patient relationship and in-person encounters. The bill also mandates a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study on pharmacies and physician practices dispensing these drugs and modifies the Medicare improvement fund.
